Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: ditto
Description: Copy directory hierarchies, create and extract archives

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Show help for ditto

Arguments.Name: h
Arguments.Description: Print full usage

Arguments.Name: X
Arguments.Description: When copying one or more source directories, do not descend into directories that have a different device ID

Arguments.Name: c
Arguments.Description: Create an archive at the destination path

Arguments.Name: z
Arguments.Description: Create compressed CPIO archives, using gzip(1) compression

Arguments.Name: j
Arguments.Description: Create compressed CPIO archives, using bzip2(1) compression

Arguments.Name: v
Arguments.Description: Print a line of output to stderr for each source directory copied

Arguments.Name: V
Arguments.Description: Print a line of output to stderr for every file, symbolic link, and device copied

Arguments.Name: x
Arguments.Description: Extract the archives given as source arguments

Arguments.Name: k
Arguments.Description: Create or extract from a PKZip archive instead of the default CPIO

Arguments.Name: --keepParent
Arguments.Description: When creating an archive, embed the parent directory name src in dst_archive

Arguments.Name: --arch
Arguments.Description: Thin Universal binaries to the specified architecture.  If multiple --arch options are specified then the resulting destination file will contain each of the specified architectures (if they are present in the source file).  arch should be specified as 'i386', 'x86_64', etc

Arguments.Name: arch
Arguments.Description: arch

Arguments.Name: --bom
Arguments.Description: Copy only files, links, devices, and directories that are present in the specified BOM

Arguments.Name: bom
Arguments.Description: bom

Arguments.Name: -rsrc
Arguments.Description: Preserve resource forks and HFS meta-data.  ditto will store this data in Carbon-compatible ._ AppleDouble files on filesystems that do not natively support resource forks.  As of Mac OS X 10.4, --rsrc is default behavior

Arguments.Name: --norsrc
Arguments.Description: Do not preserve resource forks and HFS meta-data.  If both --norsrc and --rsrc are passed, whichever is passed last will take precedence.  Both options override DITTONORSRC. Unless explicitly specified, --norsrc also implies --noextattr and --noacl to match the behavior of Mac OS X 10.4

Arguments.Name: --extattr
Arguments.Description: Preserve extended attributes (requires --rsrc). As of Mac OS X 10.5, --extattr is the default

Arguments.Name: --noextattr
Arguments.Description: Do not preserve extended attributes (requires --norsrc)

Arguments.Name: --qtn
Arguments.Description: Preserve quarantine information.  As of Mac OS X 10.5, --qtn is the default

Arguments.Name: --noqtn
Arguments.Description: Do not preserve quarantine information

Arguments.Name: --acl
Arguments.Description: Preserve Access Control Lists (ACLs).  As of Mac OS X 10.5, --acl is the default

Arguments.Name: --noacl
Arguments.Description: Do not preserve ACLs

Arguments.Name: --nocache
Arguments.Description: Do not perform copies using the Mac OS X Unified Buffer Cache. Files read and written will not be cached, although if the file is already present in the cache, the cached information will be used

Arguments.Name: --hfsCompression
Arguments.Description: When copying files or extracting content from an archive, if the destination is an HFS+ volume that supports compression, all the content will be compressed if appropriate. This is only supported on Mac OS X 10.6 or later, and is only intended to be used in installation and backup scenarios that involve system files. Since files using HFS+ compression are not readable on versions of Mac OS X earlier than 10.6, this flag should not be used when dealing with non-system files or other user-generated content that will be used on a version of Mac OS X earlier than 10.6

Arguments.Name: --nohfsCompression
Arguments.Description: Do not compress files with HFS+ compression when copying or extracting content from an archive unless the content is already compressed with HFS+ compression.  This flag is only supported on Mac OS X 10.6 or later.  --nohfsCompression is the default

Arguments.Name: --preserveHFSCompression
Arguments.Description: When copying files to an HFS+ volume that supports compression, ditto will preserve the compression of any source files that were using HFS+ compression.  This flag is only supported on Mac OS X 10.6 or later. --preserveHFSCompression is the default

Arguments.Name: --nopreserveHFSCompression
Arguments.Description: Do not preserve HFS+ compression when copying files that are already compressed with HFS+ compression. This is only supported on Mac OS X 10.6 or later

Arguments.Name: --sequesterRsrc
Arguments.Description: When creating a PKZip archive, preserve resource forks and HFS meta-data in the subdirectory __MACOSX.  PKZip extraction will automatically find these resources

Arguments.Name: --zlibCompressionLevel
Arguments.Description: Sets the compression level to use when creating a PKZip archive. The compression level can be set from 0 to 9, where 0 represents no compression, and 9 represents optimal (slowest) compression. By default, ditto will use the default compression level as defined by zlib

Arguments.Name: compression level
Arguments.Description: compression level

Arguments.Name: --password
Arguments.Description: When extracting a password-encrypted ZIP archive, you must specify --password to allow ditto to prompt for a password to use to extract the contents of the file. If this option is not provided, and a password-encrypted file is encountered, ditto will emit an error message

Arguments.Name: source
Arguments.Description: source

Arguments.Name: dest
Arguments.Description: dest
